data.name: Schöllenen Gorge
data.abstract: The Schöllenen Gorge stretches from Göschenen to Andermatt in the Gotthard region. It was here over 200 years ago that the French fought the Russians. The Suvorov Monument is a memorial to the fallen.
data.description:
There was no way to reach this beautifully wild gorge when travellers crossed the Gotthard Pass. The villagers in the Urseren Valley built the steps, wooden walkways and paths themselves. But legend has it that they needed help to build a bridge. The devil offered to help, but the villagers were able to outwit him.

In 1799 a battle pitting Napoleon’s troops against the Russians who were under the command of General Suvorov took place in Schöllenen Gorge. The Suvorov monument carved out of rock was erected in 1899 as a memorial to the Russian soldiers who fell in the battle. Russian President Dmitri Medvedev visited the monument during his state visit in 2009.

If you want a hair-raising glimpse into the depths of the Schöllenen Gorge, you should hit the Schöllenen circular hiking trail during the summer months. It is an easy walk and takes no more than 30 minutes at a leisurely pace. The towering cliff faces and the roaring torrent of the Reuss make a fascinating sight. The Teufelsbrücke restaurant is situated directly next to the bridge of the same name. In the summer months, guests can feel the magic of the legendary Gotthard as they eat and drink.

Getting there: By car or train to Göschenen or Andermatt.

data.name: City tour: City train
data.description: Getting to know Vaduz by city train "Städtlezug" as well as getting information on the country's history and the princely dynasty. The Citytrain starts from the bus terminal and takes groups; rides can be arranged also upon request. Garanteed departure daily at 4:30 PM.

data.name: Wolfer Vineyard
data.abstract: The winery is beautifully located in the midst of the vineyard of Weinfelden. In 2013 the Wolfer Vineyard was crowned world champion of the Pinot Noir producers by Mondial des Pinots.
data.description: The Wolfer family pays much attention to high-extract grapes and makes aromatic and substantial wines. During a wine tasting with a guided tour through the vineyard and the wine cellar the guests learn much about winegrowing in Weinfelden and are able to try out the wines that have received multiple awards.

data.name: Castle tour
data.description: Tarasp Castle reigns over the Lower Engadine from a magnificent hilltop perch amid soaring summits. This guided tour goes behind the scenes of the iconic castle’s more than thousand-year history and reveals why the structure still endures today. There is also opportunity to admire the works of art bestowed by new owner Not Vital that adorn the thick stone walls.

address.name: Tourismus Engadin Scuol Samnaun Val Müstair AG

data.name: Rare watchmaking technique
data.description: Vanessa Lecci, originally from Italy, is one of the few decorators of watch faces. She opens up her studio in Peseux to offer a glimpse of her highly specialised craftsmanship. Vanessa Lecci works on behalf of a variety of famous brands of watches.

data.name: Group tours at the open art Museum
data.abstract: St. Gallen has so much to offer when it comes to museums. Attractive, internationally renowned exhibitions and countless historic collections make for a diverse museum landscape. The open art Museum is particularly worth a visit.
data.description:
The open art Museum in St. Gallen is the only museum for art brut in the German-speaking region. It captures visitors' imaginations with its diverse offering and fascinating content. The museum's collection is devoted to art in the fields of art brut, outsider art and naive art. It boasts an impressive collection, comprising over 8,000 works of art by more than 180 artists.

As part of regular group tours, the museum's art education specialists will show you around the latest exhibition. Your guide is included in the normal entry fee.

image.name: Museum im Lagerhaus, St.Gallen
image.copyrightHolder: Partner image for editorial and touristic use / Museum im Lagerhaus

image.name: Museum im Lagerhaus, St.Gallen
image.copyrightHolder: Partner image for editorial and touristic use / Museum im Lagerhaus

data.name: Gaze over the Lavaux on a paddleboard
data.description: Sophie Durant has always lived at Lake Geneva and has got to know the area well from the water too. Her guided half or full-day paddleboard excursions take the group past Montreux, Clarens und Vevey. This is a chance to see the small towns from a different perspective. A walk through the picturesque Lavaux can be combined with a tasting at a local vineyard.

event.location: Le lieu de départ varie selon la balade choisie

data.name: Why Aeschi is on a moraine
data.description: Born and bred in Aeschi: During the tour of the village, the local guides talk about its history on the moraine. They know every detail and tell the stories, which are not recorded anywhere, with a great deal of humour. A memorable tour, which also includes a drink.

data.name: Treno Gottardo
data.abstract: ​The Treno Gottardo runs hourly over the 120-year-old Gotthard panorama line to the sun-kissed corner of Switzerland. The panoramic ride promises impressive views of rugged mountain faces and deep blue lakes as well as plenty of Mediterranean flair with palm trees and stately residences.
data.description:
Bustling cities, historic buildings and a great variety of nature and leisure activities – all of this can be experienced on the Treno Gottardo. The diversity of Switzerland with one single train! The new train, equipped with bistro zone and family area, runs hourly from Zurich, Basel and Lucerne to Locarno. Travel most comfortably along lakes and mountains over the historic Gotthard panorama route right to Locarno in the sun-kissed corner of Switzerland. Benvenuti!


FACTS TRENO GOTTARDO
Route: Zürich/Basel/Luzern – Bellinzona – Locarno

Duration: Zürich – Locarno: 3 h 20 min
Basel – Locarno: 4 h 22 min
Luzern – Locarno: 3 h 7 min 

EXCURSION TIPS
 * Lucerne [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/lucerne/]with its numerous sights such as the chapel bridge or the lion's monument
 * Lake Lucerne [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/experiences/boat-cruises-on-lake-lucerne/] with its impressive fleet of steamboats
 * Altdorf [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/altdorf/], main town of the canton of Uri, with the world famous Tell monument
 * The 1882 inaugurated Gotthard panorama route with the church of Wassen that can be seen from three different angles during the ride
 * The Leventina [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/leventina/]with its spectacular surroundings – with the steep funicular railway to Lake Ritom and the Strada Alta, or by cableway to Lake Tremorgio
 * The castles of Bellinzona [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/experiences/the-fortress-of-bellinzona/], part of UNESCO World Heritage since the year 2000
 * Locarno [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/locarno/]with its bustling Piazza Grande, Lake Maggiore and the famous pilgrimage church Madonna del Sasso

FOOD & BEVERAGES
Two bistro zones with snack and beverage vending machines as well as a coffee maker.

TIMETABLE
The timetable can be found here [http://sbb.ch].

TICKET
 This route is fully covered by the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and GA travelcard.
Book tickets [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/planning/transport-accommodation/tickets-public-transport/]

RESERVATION
 * Seat reservation available for individual travellers
 * Seat reservation required for groups of 10 or more persons (no surcharge)

 Go to reservations [https://sbb.ch]

data.name: Outdoor Karting Track Morschach
data.abstract: Natural power on the Outdoor Karting Track in Morschach.
data.description:
Experience pure action at Swiss Holiday Park’s outdoor karting track and enjoy an exciting afternoon go-karting with your family and friends. Or you can book the entire course for your exclusive use and organise your own race.
Morschach Karting Track is on the former parking deck in front of the leisure park and offers 18 electric karts. Unlike standard karts, electric karts make no noise and their (carbon-neutral) emissions are eliminated. Entirely in keeping with today’s spirit of climate protection, the electric karts are run on electricity from renewable sources – natural power. This power is generated at the Altdorf electricity work’s Kleintal-Isenthal hydroelectric power plant which has been awarded “naturemade basic” certification and stands for climate-friendly electricity.

data.name: Chocolate dreams can come true
data.abstract: Create exquisite chocolates with the finest truffle and praline fillings or even make your own chocolate bars and figures from yummy Swiss chocolate. miniSchoggi makes all this – and much more – possible.
data.description:
miniSchoggi offers numerous options for a variety of different occasions. Team events, family parties or maybe even a sweet-tasting hen do – just let us know! We work with you to conjure up the perfect event and make the chocolate dreams of young and old come true. Let yourself be inspired because we know – we have something for everyone!

CHOCOLATES & TRUFFLES
Under the guidance of our professional confectioners, you learn the art of filling chocolates, sealing with couverture and decorating to your heart's content.

CREATING SCHOGGI FIGURES
Decorate your own seasonal Easter Bunny. Create colourful chocolate Easter Eggs or a Christmas Boot, filled with luxurious chocolates made by your own fair hands.

SCHOGGI BAR POURING
Pour, decorate and package your own chocolate bars to your heart’s content – the sky’s the limit when it comes to your imagination.

HIGH HEELS COURSE
The high heel shoe of your dreams. With delicate flourishes and lacy bits? With clean lines and no frilly bits? We can help you create the life-size high heel shoe of your dreams using the finest Swiss chocolate.

CHOCOLATE BAR COURSE
Take part in our unique chocolate bar course and pour and decorate your own chocolate bars exactly the way you want them.

COOKIE COURSE
Take part in our cookie course and create your own edible cookie table cards – or anything else for that matter – using royal icing and a whole host of other decorations.

CUPCAKES COURSE
You’re dreaming of cupcakes as beautiful as... well, as beautiful as no one has ever made before? In our cupcakes course, we’ll teach you and your friends everything you need to know about being a cupcake baker and decorator pro!

data.name: Voyage Culinaire Zurich
data.abstract: Enjoy a culinary experience consisting of team spirit, fun and sightseeing!
data.description: This culinary event is composed of a guided tour through Zurich and gastronomic team activities revolving around the topics of food and drink. Enjoy a 3-course menu in 1-2 different venues and a wine presentation of the wines you have selected for dinner.

data.name: High above Lake Maggiore
data.abstract: Participants take to the skies with a tandem paragliding flight high above Locarno.
data.description:
The adventure starts from Cardada-Cimetta, Locarno’s local mountain, which can easily be reached by cable car. The professional paragliding pilots of Mountaingliders will take participants high up into the sky. Depending on the thermal winds, a flight lasts at least 20 minutes and promises breathtaking views on Locarno, the lake and the surrounding mountains. The landing site is either in Locarno or Ascona.
www.mountaingliders.com/ [http://www.mountaingliders.com/]

data.name: Japanese garden
data.abstract: Hikers can admire the Japanese garden perched atop a glacial moraine deep in the Tortin Valley, south of Nendaz.
data.description:
Two lateral moraines of the former glacier are still visible on the Tortin plateau. These are the small and large roof of Tortin, which were formed approximately 9,000 years ago. The Japanese garden is located on the peak of the large moraine and owes its name to its resemblance to a landscaped garden. This natural and tranquil landscape is one of a kind and has its very own ecosystem. Here hikers can enjoy glorious views of Mont Fort and of the rest of the Alps, as well as being charmed by the small stream that meanders down the valley. A shuttle bus service runs from Nendaz to the Siviez bus stop, where the hike starts. It takes three hours and twenty minutes in total (there and back).

More information [https://www.nendaz.ch/en/P72101/japanese-garden]

image.name: Nendaz, Japanischer Garten

data.name: Alp Tannenboden Alpine Cheese Dairy
data.abstract: The Alpine and traditional cheese dairy of Tannenboden was built at the turn of the century. Through a large glass pane in the cozy restaurant you can watch how cheese is made. Fine fresh dairy products such as Alpine cheese, yoghurt, butter, milk and Camenbert cheese are sold here.
data.description:
A children's playground and a large sun terrace invite visitors to tarry a while. During the Alpine grazing time you can witness cheese-making daily. Visitors can also make their own cheese over an open fire, as in the olden days. One can ideally combine the visit to Alp Tannenboden with a hearty meal - Raclette, Fondue, Älplermagronen (a Swiss pasta specialty with potatoes and cheese) - in the Alp restaurant Sennenstube.

Duration: Up to 2.5 hours
Number of participants: Up to 35 (or then two groups)
Season: Mid june - End october
Languages: German, English

data.name: Shilwald (Wildlife Park) Route
data.description:
The Sihlwald (Wildlife Park) Route takes you from Thalwil over the Albis Pass to Hausen am Albis. And from Albis you continually enjoy new breathtaking views over Lake Zurich. The Zürichsee-Rundweg (round path alongside the lake) provides views of mansions, tidy towns and natural shoreline as you pass –and of course the Sihlwald nature park is a great close-by attraction with its pristine and almost untouched nature in contrast to the urban agglomerations. (PostBus stop Langnau a.A., Schwerzi-Wildpark). 

Discover the woods’ many uses and secrets along the adventure path leading from the visitor’s centre by Sihlwald, Bahnhof. A woods-xylophone reveals the age of trees, and you can communicate with the wooden giants through a so-called tree-telephone. 

Boardwalk type catwalks over the stealthy waters invite you to ponder over the natural beauty that surrounds you –and a particular park highlight is presented in this wildlife park, with prime living examples of 19 species of Switzerland’s former domestic animals. Intentions are the reintroduction and conservation breeding. (PostBus stop Langnau a.A., Schwerzi-Wildpark). 

Observe the animals almost as wild and learn interesting facts through the interactive information facilities. Over the Albis Pass, you finally arrive at Hausen am Albis (PostBus stop Hausen am Albis, Post). From here you can take the Ämtlerweg path which, in three days, takes you from Bonstetten to the Affoltern district. Discover the beautiful nature reserves here as well, along with superb monuments such as the Cistercian monastery at Kappel am Albis, and Knonau Castle. 
Additional useful information on the PostBus excursion routes and a wealth of pictures and video clips can be found at the link in the right-hand box.

data.name: The Zurich Trolley Experience - city tour
data.abstract: Enjoy the sights of Zurich aboard the nostalgic "Classic Trolley".
data.description: This approximately 2-hour tour will show you the business and financial centre, the Bahnhofstrasse, the most important museums, the historical Limmatquai, the Grossmünster Church, St. Peter's Church with the largest clock face in Europe, the Fraumünster Church with its famous Chagall windows, residential areas, the university quarter, and vantage points of Zurich. Headphones are supplied so that you can listen to detailed commentary in the language of your choice (German, French, Italian, English, Spanish, Portuguese, Russian and Japanese). In summer you can enjoy the city tour in the open air – there is outdoor seating at the rear of the vehicle.

data.name: Sparenmoos – mystical moorland walk
data.abstract: A themed moorland walk above Zweisimmen tells walkers about the origins of moors and how to protect them. The path passes through "moorland scenery of particular beauty and national importance", which is under special protection.
data.description:
Moors are damp, poorly nourished, acidic habitats. Only very robust and undemanding plants and animals can live here. This is why you find "specialist" plants on moors such as sedges, rushes, cotton grass and orchids. Their particular colours and shapes are distinguishing features of the landscape.
A platform made of tree trunks also offers fascinating insights into the habitat of wild animals. If you are lucky, you may be able to observe chamois in the wildlife conservation area near a rushing stream.
For families, there is a "treasure hunt" to follow to discover the area, which covers nearly 1200 acres.



Sparenmoos 
• Scooter (from 6 persons)
(on request, by appointment and with existing capacity)
The Sparenmoos-Neuenberg moorland area is easily reached by public transport: there are regular buses from Zweisimmen to the Sparenmoos; it is also suitable for travelling by car, with ample parking at the station in Zweisimmen.
Circular walks from Rellerli over the Saanenmoser Pass or from the Jaun Pass.

data.name: Farinet's Trail
data.abstract: Farinet was a famous adventurer and a master of forgery. Born 150 years ago, he took refuge at Saillon and became a legend.
data.description:
In 1995, a special trail was dedicated to him. A talented glass maker from Täsch, Theo Imboden, produced 21 splendid stain-glass sculptures set along the trail leading from the foot of the hill at Saillon to the smallest vineyard in the world, the very one that once belonged to Farinet. The three-dimensional pieces catch the sun and play games with its rays all day long. 

The motives are inspired by woodcarvings the artist Robert Hèritier created for the Farinet of Budry. (About two hours roundtrip, accessible to children from 6 years.)

data.name: Fun and adventure in Balmberg
data.abstract: Fun and adventure in the magnificent Jura Forest, about 10 kilometers from Solothurn.
data.description: Nine parcours of various degrees of difficulty offer adventure and challenges for outdoor enthusiasts, families, groups and clubs. Open daily from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. in the summer season (April to October).

data.name: Treasure-hunt trail in Aeschi
data.abstract: The whole family can go on a treasure hunt in Aeschi bei Spiez. Various questions are hidden on the treasure-hunt trail that the family can find and answer together. Once the treasure hunters have answered all the questions correctly, they can pick up a reward at the tourist office.
data.description: The treasure hunters collect their treasure map at the tourist office and then head off on the three-hour trail. The simple route takes them over meadows of flowers and along the edges of forests. A number of stop-off points with questions are hidden along the way. The questions are designed for children from the age of around six. While little ones are busy answering the questions, parents can enjoy the glorious views of the Niesen and Lake Thun. As soon as they have found all the answers, the family heads back to the tourist office, where each treasure hunter can choose a reward from the treasure chest.

data.name: Schongi BobBahn – the one and only!
data.abstract: There’s only one place to bob-ride and that’s in Schongi – as much and as often as you like.
data.description:
People of all ages are thrilled with the Schongi-Bob-Bahn. And Switzerland’s one and only bob way can afford being open even when it rains, as it’s covered! Take a seat and off you go… passing the old mill, donkeys and duck pond at great speed…and when you get to the bottom you can ride right back to where you started with the drag lift and enjoy the ride again. 

The Bob-Bahn is under constant surveillance so you can sit back and enjoy a drink in a cozy restaurant in the knowledge the kids are fine.

data.name: The art that enchants light ...
data.description: Discover stained glass church windows, accompanied by a trained guide. The church window tour starts off at 10:00 hrs in Moutier. Depending on the route taken, from two to six churches can be visited. At 17:00 hrs the tour group makes its way back to Moutier.

data.name: zai experience: a private ski testing day
data.abstract: First off is testing out the skis on the mountain, followed by a look behind the scenes at how they are lovingly crafted by hand. This exclusive ski testing day promises to be a lot of fun as well as giving you some interesting insights into the ski builders' craftsmanship.
data.description:
Accompanied by a ski guide from the zai team, you will be putting all of zai’s high-tech ski models through their paces on the alternating terrain of Disentis’s slopes. You will then be allowed to take a peek behind the scenes to see how the skis are made.
Includes
 * Testing all zai ski models
 * Lunch on the mountain
 * A daily ski pass for Disentis
 * A tour of the workshop/factory

Cost
CHF 490 per person

Minimum number
Five people

Date and time
Upon request

Key info
Customised zai experiences can also be organised upon request.

data.name: Sculptures walking trail
data.abstract: Mont Sujet (1382m) lies between Lake Biel and Chasseral.
data.description: A sculpture trail winds from Lamboing to the 'Bergerie du Haut' mountain hostel (1.5 hours). An out-of-the-ordinary, somewhat steep walking trail for all nature enthusiasts. The wooden sculptures were created in 1996 by students of the Brienz Technical College for Wood Carving. Lamboing can be reached by Postbus from La Neuveville.

data.name: Ski slopes by day – toboggan run by night
data.abstract: Once the last skiers and snowboarders have left the blue slope on the Riggisalp, it is time for tobogganers to enjoy an evening downhill ride on this popular run.
data.description:
Take the chair lift or your snowshoes to get to the starting point of this toboggan run. Up top, at 1,493 m.a.s.l., you have the opportunity to treat yourself to some delicious fare at the Berghaus Riggisalp before making your rapid descent down into the valley. This run of almost 450 altitude metres is 4 kilometres long. Great fun for young and old.
Starting point: Riggisalp (1,493 m.a.s.l.)
Accessibility of starting point: Chairlift
Finishing point: Schwarzsee valley station (1,046 m.a.s.l.)
Altitude difference: 447 metres
Length: 4 kilometres
Level of difficulty: medium
Toboggan hire onsite: yes
Illuminated for night sledging: yes
Option to eat: at the start and at the finish

data.name: The cockpit of a steam engine
data.description: On the Schynige Platte cogwheel train like in the olden times: On the ride from Wilderswil to Schynige Platte, the visitors are welcome to help fire up the steam engine, load coal and water and lubricate the equipment. As a souvenir, they receive a stoker’s hat and a certificate.

data.name: Tasty food from Vreni’s garden
data.description: Vreni Hofer-Galli lives in in Dieterswil near Bern in a house which is more than 200 years old. Since both her daughters have moved out, the farming woman is delighted to host guests. Vegetables, salad, squash – all from her garden, just like the plums she uses for the dessert.

price.description: CHF 46.00 per child CHF 96.00 incl. wine

data.name: Excursion: Mountain Climbing, Mt. Pilatus and Mt. Titlis
data.abstract: Ascending one of Central Switzerland's alpine peaks is an easy day trip from Lucerne.
data.description: Mt. Pilatus (7,000 feet high and home to the world's steepest cogwheel railway) and Mt. Titlis (at 10,000 feet, central Switzerland's highest peak) are two of the region's most popular climbs. Bus or train transport carries visitors along the shores of Lake Lucerne to a cable car, which whisks riders up to the top. The reward is a sweeping view of snowy, purple mountain peaks and the meandering Lake Lucerne.

data.name: Technique training in Davos Nordic Park
data.abstract: Jumping in cross-country skis? It can be done – and worth trying out! Just in front of the cross-country centre, a slope has been prepared that offers a novel way of getting into cross-country skiing.
data.description:
The 12 stages along the Favos cross-country ski course encourage skiers and help them to improve their balance and coordination – having fun while doing so. This includes exercises such as ski jumping, doing a spot of slalom or skiing across a seesaw. Davos Nordic Park is located at the cross-country ski centre on Hertistrasse in the centre of the 175-kilometre long network of cross-country trails. Use of the facility is open to all free of charge throughout the entire winter season.
The ground floor of the cross-country ski centre contains a lounge area with catering facilities, dressing rooms, toilets and a waxing room.

More information [https://www.davos.ch/winter/aktivitaeten/langlauf/davos-nordic-park/]

image.name: Langlaufpark in Davos
image.copyrightHolder: Partner image for editorial and touristic use / bestoffdavos@gmail.com.marcel giger. snow -world.ch

data.name: Snow shoe hiking with raclette
data.description: Explore the winter mountain landscape on this snow shoe hike in the twilight. The group will spend around 90 minutes walking through the snow, accompanied by a mountain guide as they climb. The experience will come to a cosy end up in the mountain restaurant, where either raclette or fondue are on offer.

address.name: Ecole Suisse de Ski et de Snowboard

data.name: Bierhübeli
data.abstract: Regular popular live acts and dance parties guarantee for a great time at this renowned cultural joint, while you relax over a drink in the lounge.
data.description:
Hall. Every week popular live acts and dance parties. The stage disappears behind a velvet curtain, when it is not used. On one side and in the back this big hall has a balcony with a good view of the stage.

Lounge. Whether you want to enjoy a cocktail in quiet before the concert or get away for a moment of peace, when the party in the big hall is in full swing. The Bierhübeli lounge is a suitable place to retreat and guarantees good vibrations! Admission is free.

Beer garden. In the beer garden under beautiful chestnut trees you can enjoy ice-cold beer and excellent snacks: From weisswurst with pretzels and cheese salad to spare ribs and home-made apple pie.

data.name: Across the vineyards by train
data.abstract: The “Train des vignes” (vineyard train) runs on a fantastic route through the terraced vineyards of Lavaux, the landscape high above Lake Geneva designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2007, with views of the Savoy and Valais Alps.
data.description:
An hourly regional train from Vevey station to Puidoux-Chexbres offers the unusual experience of travelling across the terraced vineyards of the Lavaux UNESCO World Heritage Site. From Chexbres-Village station, where the train stops along the way, there are many footpaths through the magnificent, steep terraces. A signposted educational trail tells the story of the vineyard and the grape varieties grown there. 

The “Lavaux Panoramic” is a tourist train with tyred wheels that carries visitors from Chexbres-Village along narrow roads through the vineyards. On the way, travellers can learn about the characteristics of the region as they admire the spectacular landscape. Similar trains known as the “Lavaux Express” also run through the Lavaux vineyards from Lutry and Cully. The winegrowers offer tourists the chance to taste their wines in their cellars.

data.name: Descend the Heuberg Mountain by bike-board
data.abstract: It is one of the longest toboggan runs in Switzerland in the winter, and almost certainly the longest downhill bike-board trail in the summer.
data.description:
The 12 km route into the valley provides the ideal conditions for superb bike-board descents in the summer. Equipment is available in the mountain lodge.
Those who wish to use the daily bus service have to register by telephone in advance. The Heuberg is also accessible by car. Permits to use the Heubergstrasse road are available at the Sagi car park in the village and in the mountain lodge.

data.name: Your guide to the perfect ski day
data.abstract: Everyone dreams of experiencing the ultimate ski day during their holidays. In reality, achieving this is often not easy – particularly when time is short and there are a huge number of pistes to choose from, as is the case in Zermatt. We’ve put together a step-by-step guide with tips from the locals to guarantee you an unforgettable day on the snow.
data.description:
We’ve all been there: You arrive on holiday in a new ski region and have no idea how to get the best out of your time there. Where is the best place to eat lunch with children, where are the quiet terraces for those looking to soak up a few rays and which après-ski bar is the place to go if you are in the mood for dancing? How can you find out all that the region has to offer? The answer is simple: Zermatt now has a guide to help sporty skiers, families and connoisseurs alike all enjoy the perfect ski day.

More information [https://www.zermatt.ch/Dein-perfekter-Skitag]

image.name: Sportlicher Skifahrer vor dem Matterhorn
image.copyrightHolder: Partner image for editorial and touristic use / Pascal Gertschen

image.name: Familie beim Zustieg zu den Bergbahnen Zermatt
image.copyrightHolder: Partner image for editorial and touristic use

data.name: Alpine games team challenge
data.abstract: A variety of team challenges with the potential to unlock positive emotions are on offer in the heart of the fascinating Jungfrau mountain region.
data.description:
Divided into teams, you will compete in various challenging disciplines in a bid to take the title, with lots of laughs along the way.
Whether you prefer an alpine game that requires participants to demonstrate their skills, carry out traditional Swiss customs or simply rely on luck, the choice is endless. We would be happy to help you choose the games and plan your stay.
Once the game is done, why not celebrate the results over an aperitif or meal with regional produce from the Jungfrau region, sharing any outstanding achievements and laughing about any mishaps along the way.
Shared adventures in unique natural surroundings not only promote team spirit, but also highlight the importance of a sustainable corporate event. All our games require nothing but manpower, the venue is located in the heart of nature and is easily accessible by public transport – usually by train or, for an even more spectacular arrival, by gondola lift.
We aim to play our part by ensuring that our events are not only entertaining but also have a positive impact on the environment. Thatʼs why we make sure that our games are environmentally friendly and sustainable.

Our current range of games includes the following activities and is continuously updated:

 * Alpine horn challenge
 * Labyrinth
 * Eiger North Face climb
 * Milk stool curling
 * Maxi ski racing
 * Maxi Jenga
 * Snow sculpture making
 * Snowbike & sled trail
 * Photo shoot
 * Flag throwing

As organisers of corporate events, we attach great importance to sustainability and the responsible use of natural resources.

data.name: Wirzweli witch-path
data.abstract: Tracing back the footsteps of the herbalist Witch "Lizi" along the Wirzweli witch-path is an enchanting experience for children over four years of age.
data.description:
Getting to Wirzweli in 10 minutes with the Dallenwil-Wirzweli adventure cable car is already fun in itself. And from the mountain station, you reach the Gummenalp cable car in around 15 minutes – where cabins for 4 safely deliver both big and small adventurers to the Gummenalp. 
Here real adventure begins! 
Already on opening the creaky old entrance door you’re confronted with the first surprise. The witch-path leads on through the woods, passing 14 enchanted witch-stations. 
Easy hike suited to children of 4 years and over, although not suitable for prams. 

Grill spots along the way 

Hiking time approx. 1 hour depending on the amount of time spent at the various stations. Approx. 1.5 hours in the opposite direction. 

Fairy-tale book about "Lizi" online [http://shop.dod.ch/Default.aspx?ControlToLoad=ItemCard&ItemNo=108] or available at the valley station of the adventure cable car. 

Further information about thewitch-path [http://www.lakeluzern.ch/de/page.cfm/Erlebnisse/Sommer/SommerWandernWalken/Kinderthemen-Wege/27312]

data.name: Nordic Walking in the Mettau valley
data.description: Four routes of varying degrees of difficulty; total 45 km. On the "Helsana Swiss running/walking trail", both beginners and more athletic walkers will learn the correct techniques for walking, Nordic walking and running. There are also tips about strengthening and stretching exercises, coordination training and the correct intensity of training. All routes begin from the church in Mettau.

data.name: A freestyle paradise on the mountain and in the hall
data.abstract: The Alaïa Chalet is THE meeting place for all freestyle fans who can’t get enough of the sport. During the day, they can be found launching themselves into the air from the half pipe in one of Switzerland’s biggest snow parks, then in the evening the training continues indoors.
data.description:
Covering an area of 5,000 square metres, the Alaïa Chalet is one of the largest indoor freestyle centres in Switzerland. Whether you are a professional or an ambitious beginner, the training facilities in Crans Montana are second to none. The trampolines provide plenty of opportunity to practise jumps for your next visit to the half pipe. Beginners can set themselves personal challenges on the indoor and outdoor skate parks. After a day in the snow park and an evening in the hall, the chalet’s own bar offers the perfect place to unwind.

More information [https://alaia.ch/en]

data.name: Indoor Rope Adventure Park Grindelwald
data.abstract: Visit Europe’s largest indoor rope adventure park at the Grindelwald Sport Centre...
data.description:
...in any kind of weather. It stays dry and windless in winter and cool in summer. This is your chance to experience the Eiger indoors!

On five different courses with 40 elements all about mountains, you will experience many highlights. Overcome giant icicles, soar through the air with the Haul Bag, or wend your way over the challenging Hintersoisser Traverse – in any kind of weather.
The Grindelwald Indoor Rope Park is open from Wednesday to Sunday from 2 pm to 10 pm (last entry to a course at 9 pm).  * Alternative opening times for the Indoor Rope Park can be requested for groups (min. 6 people)
 * Minimum height: 140 cm/4 ft 7 in
 * Maximum weight: 120 kg/18 stone 8
 * Children under 12 must be accompanied by an adult.
 * Children under 18 must have written permission from a parent or guardian
 * Free admission on your birthday (ID required)

data.name: Snowlis Children's land
data.abstract: Snowli and his team of trained children’s ski instructors look forward to helping lots of kids who want to make their first attempts at snow sports here. The meeting place is Hüttenberg, which has a school-owned lift for children attending the ski kindergarten.
data.description:
Family vacations in Braunwald mean rest and recuperation for mom and dad, fun and action for the young tikes, and peace and quiet for the grandparents. The special leisure offerings for children and youths also guarantees hours of relaxation for single parents. 
Exact location / area: Hüttenberg, Braunwald (1,300 m.a.s.l.) 
Accessibility: Mountain railway, on foot
Infrastructure: Snow carousel, fitness circuit, igloo
Children’s ski racing: Yes
Size: 35,000 m² 
Min.age: from 4 years
Supervision by children’s ski instructors: Yes. Mornings from 10 am 12 noon, afternoons from 2 pm to 4 pm (without lunch)
Own use without supervision: No
Try-out lessons: Yes
Restaurant with view of the kids’ snow playground: Hotel Cristal

data.name: Gantrisch biking
data.description: A recommendation: Demanding route on signposted trails from the Selital valley to the Horbüel Pass vantage point, then up and down across pasture land to Hällstett. Following this, a difficult descent, ultimately arriving at Riffenmatt. 15km, difference in elevation 610m. The "Gantrisch Biking" association maintains the 200-km-long bikers' network containing six marked routes, described in the "Gantrisch Bike Map".

data.name: Madrisaland Adventure Park
data.abstract: A four-person gondola and 7 other ski lifts transport Madrisa fans to a mountain area that boasts a great variety of sports and leisure activities – 30km of pistes, an 7,7km tobogganing run and 3,5km of winter hiking trails. The highlight of the cable cars and mountain railways here is the six-seater Schaffürggli chair lift: as the most modern chair lift in Switzerland right now, it features heated seats, a hood and fully automatic closing and opening for wheelchair users.
data.description:
The Madrisa region is perfect for skiing families! A large number of offers are geared to the needs of families: it’s a paradise for children. In the Kinderland, in the heart of the skiing area of Madrisa, your child can really let off steam. Magic carpets, ski lifts, a carousel, a bouncing castle, trampoline, Skidoo for kids up to age 12, and much more, lets the hearts of the young guests jump for joy. 
Exact location / area: Madrisa, Klosters (1,887 m.a.s.l.) 
Accessibility: Mounmtain railway, post bus / bus, car, on foot 
Infrastructure: Magic carpet / conveyor belt, lift for beginners
Children’s ski racing: Yes 
Size: 1,000 m² 
Min. age: from 3 years 
Supervision by children’s ski instructors: Yes. Mornings from 10 am to 12 noon, afternoons from 2 pm to 4 pm (without lunch) 
Own use without supervision: Yes, free of charge 
Try-out lessons: Yes 
Restaurant with view of the kids’ snow playground: Bergrestaurant Madrisa-Alp, Bergrestaurant Madrisa-Hof

data.name: Eiger-Rotstock - via ferrata with a feel of the North Face
data.abstract: The via ferrata on the Rotstock, 260 metres in length, is a route for via ferrata walkers and experienced mountain walkers with a head for heights (and with the right safety equipment). The key to the climb is the vertical section immediately after the start. In the event of snow, strong rain or ice, this is very definitely not a route to be climbed. Like anywhere else on the Eiger, rock-falls cannot be ruled out.
data.description:
Difficulty
K2. Slightly to moderately difficult.
Valley/Starting-point:
Eigergletscher station (2,320 m), by rail from Interlaken Ost via Wengen or Grindelwald and Kleine Scheidegg (2,061 m).

Walk-in
From the Eigergletscher station, follow the Eiger Trail to the grassy hillock at Wart, and then follow paths up to the start point at 2,400 m, behind a mountain-top, with the Rotstockschlucht gorge immediately to your left: 45 minutes. 
Eiger-Rotstock via ferrata:
The course of the route via the new-old via ferrata is easily visible; easy walking sections are marked only with cairns. From the saddle of Rotstock, you quickly climb in stages onto the flat peak of Rotstock (2,663 m), with sheer faces on all sides; 1 hour 15 minutes from the start. 

Descent
Head back to the saddle and then to the south-west, across scree and slab sections (cairns and fixed ropes) down to the Eigergletscher station; 45 minutes. 


[/imglib/USP/k_buch.jpg] Quelle:
Eugen E. Hüsler/Daniel Anker: Wandern vertikal. Die Klettersteige der Schweiz, AT Verlag, Baden 2004  

Region: Bernese Oberland, North Wall of the Eiger 
Peak: Rotstock (2,663 m)
Time required: climb 2 hours, descent 45 minutes.
Variation in height: climb and descent 420 m.

For this trail, we recommend checking with the local tourism organization [https://grindelwald.swiss/en/service/operating-status/status-of-installations.html] in advance to confirm if it is open.

data.name: Chocolate tour in Lavaux
data.abstract: An unusual way to enjoy chocolate: as they hike through the Lavaux area, guests learn more about the history of everyone’s favourite sweet temptation and savour the delights of Grand Cru pralines.
data.description: An experienced chocolatier reveals the aromatic richness of the finest cocoa beans during a tour of the breathtaking natural scenery of Lake Geneva, inviting guests to immerse themselves in the world of chocolate. Naturally there are also plenty of opportunities to taste the products themselves.

image.name: Lavaux, chocolat en balade

data.name: Offpiste safari in a ski region
data.description: While visitors will not get to see lions and elephants on this safari in the Lenzerheide region, a ski safari is a chance to go deeper into silence of the imposing mountain world, far from the ski lifts and prepared pistes. Accompanied by a ski guide, the group will discover concealed forest clearings and cross incredible fields of untouched snow. Tours start in Arosa, Lenzerheide or Tschiertschen.

data.name: Fast descent with the Bikeboard
data.abstract: When the summer season approaches, the first fast bikeboard ride is kicked off. The trendy sports equipment is simple to handle and guarantees an exciting adventure.
data.description:
The 6-seater gondola lift whisks you from Emmetten to the lofty height of the Stockhütte. Here, you can rent a bikeboard, put on a helmet and off you go, zipping down into the valley. If you can’t get enough of it, simply ride up again. The wonderful view over the Lucerne Region and Lake Lucerne makes the excursion a special experience. 
The bikeboard rental is inside the mountain station of the Emmetten-Stockhütte gondola lift. Length of the route: 5.7 km

data.name: Abbey Basilica - Monastery Treasure
data.abstract: The Abbey of Saint Maurice in Valais was built 1500 years ago as a place to honor martyrs. The pilgrimage destination was once the spiritual center of the Burgundy Empire and today houses one of the richest ecclesiastical treasures in Europe.
data.description:
Abbey of St. Maurice d'Agaune – 15 centuries of uninterrupted history

Aguanum, a place of worship since ancient Celtic times, was renamed Saint-Maurice after the martyrdom of the Theban Legion at the turn of the 4th century. Founded in the year 515, the Abbey of St. Maurice in Valais is the oldest Christian monastery in the Western world to have existed without interruption in its original location. The canons have continued their Laus Perennis - perpetual prayer – day after day, for the last 1,500 years.

As a cultural heritage site of global significance, the Abbey has opened a new and updated tour to the public. Today, visitors can discover the basilica, the archaeological site of the former churches and the jewels of the new treasury using an original audio guide with music. Thanks to video reconstructions and computer-generated images, they can walk through 1,500 years of ancient history. 
Open throughout the year, every day except Mondays. Bookshop, souvenirs and produce from the Abbey cellars. Visitors can attend the perpetual prayer. Details of opening hours: www.abbaye-stmaurice.ch [http://www.abbaye-stmaurice.ch/]

data.name: Magiclift Paragliding School
data.abstract: A trial day offering a fun-filled introduction to the world of paragliding
data.description: These state-of-the-art training paragliders are easy to control, so you'll be making small hops after just a few attempts on your trial day. As your skills improve, follow the instructions by radio and take off on your first short paragliding flights on the training slope.

data.name: Moor Experience
data.abstract: The moorland experience in the Stoos region is the ideal outing for more fun that you ever imagined − and a chance to learn "more about moors".
data.description: This entertaining tour of the moorland features various installations that offer information about the Teufböni moor. The large signboards along the moorland trail contain eight "Moorse" codes that can be rubbed onto the collecting card in the brochure. Children (and adults who enjoy collecting clues) can exchange the complete "Moorse" code card for a small surprise at the mountain station of the Morschach-Stoos cableway.
